phyz@home
distributed quantum gravity
S_EE = (1/4 G_N) × A_cut
1. A Regge lattice (triangulated 4-sphere) defines discrete spacetime.
2. Your browser solves for the ground state of an SU(2) gauge field on this lattice — a 1024×1024 eigenvalue problem.
3. The lattice is split into two regions. Entanglement entropy SEE across the cut is measured, along with the geometric cut area Acut.
4. If gravity emerges from entanglement, SEE scales linearly with Acut — the slope gives Newton's constant GN.
phase 1: 7,200 eigensolves (levels 0–1) • phase 2: 6,100 eigensolves (level 3)
